t: Zechariah 14
The Day of the Lord
Behold,*pn the day of the Lord*s is coming, And*ld your spoil will be divided in your midst.

For*ld I will gather all the nations to battle against Jerusalem; The*ld city shall be taken, The*ld houses rifled, And*ld the women ravished. Half*ld of the city shall go into captivity, But*ld the remnant of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
Then*ln the Lord*s will go forth And*ld fight against those nations, As*ld He fights in the day of battle.

And*ld in that day His feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, Which*ld faces Jerusalem on the east. And*ld the Mount of Olives shall be split in two, From*ld east to west, Making*ild a very large valley; Half*ld of the mountain shall move toward the north And*ld half of it toward the south.

Then*ld you shall flee through*i My mountain valley, For*ld the mountain valley shall reach to Azal. Yes,*ld you shall flee As*ld you fled from the earthquake In*ld the days of Uzziah king of Judah. Thus*ln the Lord*s my God will come, And*ild all the saints with You.
It*ln shall come to pass in that day That*ild there will be no light; The*ld lights will diminish.
It*ld shall be one day Which*ld is known to the Lord—*s Neither*ld day nor night. But*ld at evening time it shall happen That*ild it will be light.

And*ln in that day it shall be That*ild living waters shall flow from Jerusalem, Half*ld of them toward the eastern sea And*ld half of them toward the western sea; In*ld both summer and winter it shall occur.
And*ld the Lord*s shall be King over all the earth. In*ld that day it shall be— “The*ld Lord*s is*i one,” And*ld His name one.

All*p the land shall be turned into a plain from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem. Jerusalem*i shall be raised up and inhabited in her place from Benjamin’s Gate to the place of the First Gate and the Corner Gate, and from*i the Tower of Hananel to the king’s winepresses.
The*ipn people*i shall dwell in it; And*ld no longer shall there be utter destruction, But*ld Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited.

And*p this shall be the plague with which the Lord*s will strike all the people who fought against Jerusalem: Their*pn flesh shall dissolve while they stand on their feet, Their*ld eyes shall dissolve in their sockets, And*ld their tongues shall dissolve in their mouths.
It*ln shall come to pass in that day That*ild a great panic from the Lord*s will be among them. Everyone*ld will seize the hand of his neighbor, And*ld raise his hand against his neighbor’s hand;
Judah*ld also will fight at Jerusalem. And*ld the wealth of all the surrounding nations Shall*ld be gathered together: Gold,*ld silver, and apparel in great abundance.
Such*ln also shall be the plague On*ld the horse and*i the mule, On*ld the camel and the donkey, And*ld on all the cattle that will be in those camps. So*ld shall*i this plague be.*i
The Nations Worship the King

And*p it shall come to pass that*i everyone who is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem shall go up from year to year to worship the King, the Lord*s of hosts, and to keep the Feast of Tabernacles.
And it shall be that*i whichever of the families of the earth do not come up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the Lord*s of hosts, on them there will be no rain.

If the family of Egypt will not come up and enter in, they shall*i have*i no rain;*i they shall receive the plague with which the Lord*s strikes the nations who do not come up to keep the Feast of Tabernacles.
This shall be the punishment of Egypt and the punishment of all the nations that do not come up to keep the Feast of Tabernacles.
In*p that day “HOLINESS*i TO*i THE*i LORD”*i shall be engraved*i on the bells of the horses. The pots in the Lord’s*s house shall be like the bowls before the altar.

Yes, every pot in Jerusalem and Judah shall be holiness to the Lord*s of hosts. Everyone who sacrifices shall come and take them and cook in them. In that day there shall no longer be a Canaanite in the house of the Lord*s of hosts.
